intro: Trasus flavus var. duplex, commonly known as the double-flowered yellow bellflower, is a unique variant of the yellow bellflower species. This plant is characterized by its striking, double-layered flowers that display a vibrant yellow hue. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is native to specific regions in southern Europe. The botanical features include lance-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
